overview: Water and night. The night flows through the water as a substance that cannot be grabbed, fugitive and mysterious, which changes places every time the camera focuses it. Carla Andrade shoots the lake with that feeling, between expectant and contemplative, which nourishes her wish to see and hear all that is out of the scene: the transformation of the night that, like a rumour, follows the course of the water.
title: Bocanoite
